p: Pigeons are reared as pet birds, and pigeon racing is a popular sport. These birds also have close relationship with humans. Phan et al. (2013) collected fecal specimens from feral pigeons. They identified and proposed a new genus, namely aviparvovirus. Two related picornaviruses, Mesivirus-1 and -2, were also characterized. Moreover, they described group G RV from pigeons. Teske et al. (2017) identified novel aviadenovirus (pigeon adenovirus 2) in the fecal virome of domestic pigeons, sequenced on Illumina MiSeq platform. This novel virus may have immunosuppressive potential, which has a role in the evolution of a multifactorial disease, the young pigeon disease syndrome.
